episodes.title: Where We've Been, Our First Fight, and the Future of the Podcast
episodes.description: We are back! After a much longer than anticipated break, we are back in the swing of things and ready to talk about the future of this channel. One reason we were out longer was because we had our first fight, and today we talk through how we work through some hard feelings while dealing with trauma and triggers. We missed you!

episodes.title: The War on Christmas, Santa's Magic, and Caroling
episodes.description: Join us today as we discuss how our Christmas traditions and views on the holiday have changed since leaving a cult! It still feels weird to not get offended when someone says "Happy Holidays."

episodes.title: Steven Anderson, IVF, and Does Life Begin at Conception
episodes.description: Join us today as we watch and review another unhinged video from Steven Anderson, this time around the subject of IVF specifically. We walk through our own beliefs surrounding abortion and when life begins, and show  biblically, scientifically, and morally why we believe what we do.

episodes.title: Greg Boyle Retiring, Wasted Potential, and Crying to Your Mom 2
episodes.description: Join us today as we discuss recent news out of Faith Baptist Church- Head Pastor Greg Boyle is retiring. While we are very glad to hear that an abuse enabler will no longer be in power, we are so disappointed that another Pastor with a history of protecting abusers, Rick Donley, has been recommended to take over. It's disheartening that after so many stories of surviving abuse at that church have been made public Faith could just be trading one toxic leader for another.

episodes.title: Confessions of a Closeted Lesbian with Sarah Marsh
episodes.description: Join us today as we talk with our next guest Sarah about the challenges and true persecution she experienced growing up gay in the IFB cult. This is another person we are very connected to personally and are so grateful for Sarah sharing her story with us!

episodes.title: Confessions of a Teen Mom with Devony Audet
episodes.description: Join us today as we talk with our next guest, Devony Audet. Devony got pregnant at 16 in the IFB, and shares with us some of the struggles and successes of becoming a parent at a young age, and the added burden of being in a high control religion while navigating that experience.

episodes.title: Confessions of a Child Abuse Survivor- Josie's Story
episodes.description: Join us today as Josie tells her story of surviving years of sexual abuse at Faith Baptist Church in Spokane, WA. We recorded this several months ago, and finally feel ready to share all the gory details. Sadly this is not an isolated incident at this church or in the IFB, and we want to share this not only as a warning to people in these churches but also as an encouragement to other survivors- your story matters.

episodes.title: Steven Anderson, Demon Possession, and Mocking Mental Health
episodes.description: Join us today as we delve deeper into the NIFB and look at the first sermon Steven Anderson preached after being released from an involuntary psychiatric hold. He spends some time claiming that mental illnesses are in several cases demon possession, and mocks people who need help or medication to manage those illnesses. The way that these churches think and preach about mental health has been shown time and time again to be unkind, unsympathetic and full on destructive- and even after experiencing a psych ward he still hasn't found any empathy.

episodes.title: Steven Anderson, Soulwinning and The NIFB Movement
episodes.description: Join us today as we discuss the cult known as the New Independent Fundamental Baptists, or NIFB, and the abuse allegations surrounding their founder, Steven Anderson. We also talk about our experience going door to door soulwinning as teenagers and take a look at some of the NIFB's problematic beliefs.

episodes.title: Suicide, Antidepressants, and Jesus Quarantining
episodes.description: Join us today as we dig more into the teachings of the late David Baker. David Baker was an IFB preacher who committed suicide shortly after being charged with sexual assault of a minor. Suicidal thoughts and mental health are sorely under-recognized and under-supported in cults like the IFB, so in this episode Josie shares her experiences of suicide attempts in high school and Kristy opens up about her suicidal ideations post-partum.

episodes.title: Halloween, School Shootings, and Harry Potter
episodes.description: Join us today as we talk through some of the crazy restrictions the IFB has surrounding Halloween and all the things we weren't allowed to do (Josie's never been trick or treating). We also talk about some of Kristy's recent experience with her daughter having to go through school shooting drills.

episodes.title: Confessions of a Troubled Teen with Lauren Knight
episodes.description: Join us today as we talk with Lauren, another former troubled teen that was subject to the horrors of Anchor Character Training Center. Lauren and Michelle, on of our prior guests, were at Anchor together. Lots of tears in this episode, and we are so proud of Lauren for having the courage to speak up against this place.

episodes.title: David Baker, Fallen Pastors and Orgasms
episodes.description: Join us this week to talk through the circumstances around David Baker, an IFB preacher charged with aggravated sexual battery of a minor, who committed suicide almost immediately after making bail. We also discuss what it means to be a fallen pastor, and the orgasm gap between men and women- specifically in the IFB and other cults.

episodes.title: Confessions of a Misunderstood Kid with Cody Cook
episodes.description: Join us and our next guest, Cody, to talk about bullying and discrimination in the IFB. Cody is autistic, and experienced a really sad amount of hate from other kids and from staff at Faith Baptist Church and Faith Baptist Academy. We are so happy to see him in a much better place now, and hope his story can give some hope to others who are still experiencing that.

episodes.title: Sermon Series with Paul Chappell
episodes.description: Join us to talk about the end times! Today we go back to church to talk about the IFB theology in Revelation and what Paul Chappell believes this world is coming to.

episodes.title: Book Club: When Risqué is Okay Part 2
episodes.description: Join us as we continue taking a deeper look into "When Risqué is Okay" by Clint Caviness. The things that come out of this man's mind into this book are just beyond contemptible.

episodes.title: Ballerina Farm, Homesteading, and $30,000 Ovens
episodes.description: Join us as we review the Times article written about popular TikTok influencer "Ballerina Farm," aka Hannah Neeleman. Today we talk about homesteading, the trad wife movement, and the lack of choice that so many women are subjected to in fundamentalist cults.

episodes.title: Confessions of A Troubled Teen with Michelle Hall Harding
episodes.description: Join us and our special guest Michelle as we talk through her experiences as a "troubled teen" and some of the horrific things that happened at Anchor Character Training Center. We are incredibly grateful for Michelle's bravery in sharing this story, and we know this just scratches the surface of the atrocities committed at this place.

episodes.title: Deconstruction, A Mental Health Crisis and Paul Chappell
episodes.description: Join us as we talk through our deconstruction journeys and take a deeper look at an insensitive post from popular IFB pastor, Paul Chappell. Kristy gets very honest about her postpartum mental health journey and shares some of the hardships of deconstruction as a parent.

episodes.title: Confessions of a Labeled Liar with Lisa Michelle
episodes.description: Join us as we talk with our third guest, Lisa Michelle, about her experience growing in a high ranking IFB family. Telling this story took so much courage, and we are honored that we get to listen and share it today.

episodes.title: Sermon Series with Greg Boyle
episodes.description: Join us for our first church service in years! In this episode, we attend a mid-week church service with a sermon delivered by Greg Boyle from Faith Baptist Church. Strongly suggest watching the video for this one, we have some great facial expressions!

episodes.title: Confessions of an Atheist Mom with Amelia Protiva
episodes.description: Join us as we talk with our second guest, Amelia, who has a very compelling story on her spiritual journey from a hardcore IFB, IBLP, homeschooler to a confident atheist wife and mother.

episodes.title: Cult Confessions Book Club: When Risqué is Okay
episodes.description: Join us as we review just the prologue from the popular IFB marriage book "When Risqué is Okay" by Clint Caviness. Content warning, lots of talk about sex in this one!

episodes.title: Cult Confessions: Why We Choose to Call the IFB a Cult
episodes.description: Join us as we discuss why we have chosen to describe the Independent Fundamental Baptist Church as a cult!

episodes.title: Cult Confessions: The Confessions of a Drag Queen with Jay Breeden
episodes.description: We are excited to celebrate Pride Month with our first guest, Jay Breeden! Join us as we discuss growing up queer in a high control religion, and hear our first Cult Confession.

episodes.title: Cult Confessions: School Rules, Losing Purity Rings, and Dress Checks
episodes.description:
Episode 2: School Rules, Losing Purity Rings, and Dress Checks.

Join us as we talk about some of the rules we had to follow while going to IFB schools and churches! Comment below the most ridiculous rule you had to follow in high control religion.

episodes.title: Cult Confessions: Band Aids on Nipples and Deconstructing Sandwiches, Episode 1
episodes.description: Welcome to the first episode of Cult Confessions! Join us as we discuss growing up in a high control religion and how we're moving forward by doing our best to make things better for the ones that come after us.
